perturbation.original_text: The term of this IP Agreement shall be from the Effective Date until all of the Intellectual Property licensed hereunder is in the public domain (provided, however, that in such event the representations and warranties in Article III shall survive (and terminate) in accordance with the Acquisition Agreement) or this IP Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 4.3. This IP Agreement shall not expire or terminate for any other reason (even in the event of a material breach).
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this IP Agreement shall be from the Effective Date until all of the Intellectual Property licensed hereunder is in the public domain (provided, however, that in such event the representations and warranties in Article III shall survive (and terminate) in accordance with the Acquisition Agreement) or this IP Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 4.3. This IP Agreement shall expire and/or terminate for any reason, including a material breach.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by stating that 'This IP Agreement shall expire and/or terminate for any reason, including a material breach,' which directly conflicts with the original statement 'This IP Agreement shall not expire or terminate for any other reason (even in the event of a material breach).'

perturbation.original_text: Each of the parties acknowledges and agrees that the licenses granted hereunder (i) are irrevocable and (ii) may not be terminated for any reason (even in the event of a material breach), except that (a) with respect to Licensed IP that constitutes Third-Party Intellectual Property, solely as provided in Section 2.4(a), (b) with respect to a particular Patent licensed under this IP Agreement, the license granted to such Patent shall automatically terminate upon the expiration of the statutory term (including all extensions and renewals) of such Patent, and (c) Seller may terminate the license granted to the Purchaser Licensees pursuant to Section 2.2(c) (and no other provision of this IP Agreement), following the Initial Closing Date and upon prior written notice to Purchaser, in the event Purchaser materially breaches Section 2.2(c) and fails to cure such material breach within one hundred twenty (120) days after Purchaser's receipt of written notice from Seller (which such notice shall contain a reasonable description of such material breach and a statement of Seller's intent to terminate the license granted to the Purchaser Licensees pursuant to Section 2.2(c) if such material breach is not cured within such one hundred twenty (120) day period). Nothing herein shall preclude any party from seeking damages or other remedies at law or in equity (other than termination of this IP Agreement or any license to any Intellectual Property granted under this IP Agreement) for any breach hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the parties acknowledges and agrees that the licenses granted hereunder (i) are revocable and (ii) may be terminated for any reason (even in the event of a material breach), except that (a) with respect to Licensed IP that constitutes Third-Party Intellectual Property, solely as provided in Section 2.4(a), (b) with respect to a particular Patent licensed under this IP Agreement, the license granted to such Patent shall automatically terminate upon the expiration of the statutory term (including all extensions and renewals) of such Patent, and (c) Seller may terminate the license granted to the Purchaser Licensees pursuant to Section 2.2(c) (and no other provision of this IP Agreement), following the Initial Closing Date and upon prior written notice to Purchaser, in the event Purchaser materially breaches Section 2.2(c) and fails to cure such material breach within one hundred twenty (120) days after Purchaser's receipt of written notice from Seller (which such notice shall contain a reasonable description of such material breach and a statement of Seller's intent to terminate the license granted to the Purchaser Licensees pursuant to Section 2.2(c) if such material breach is not cured within such one hundred twenty (120) day period). Nothing herein shall preclude any party from seeking damages or other remedies at law or in equity, which includes termination of this IP Agreement or any license to any Intellectual Property granted under this IP Agreement for any breach hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by stating that the licenses are now 'revocable' and 'may be terminated for any reason', directly conflicting with the original terms of 'irrevocable' and 'may not be terminated'. It adds more uncertainty by allowing termination of this IP Agreement or any license.

perturbation.original_text: The sole and exclusive remedy for any breach of this IP Agreement, including the representations and warranties and covenants herein, shall be as set forth in Article 8 of the Acquisition Agreement. The representations and warranties and covenants contained herein shall terminate in accordance with Section 8.4 of the Acquisition Agreement
perturbation.changed_text: The sole and exclusive remedy for any breach of this IP Agreement, including the representations and warranties and covenants herein, shall be monetary compensation. The representations and warranties and covenants contained herein shall survive indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct contradiction. The original text refers to Article 8 of the Acquisition Agreement for remedies, while the modified text limits the remedy to monetary compensation only. Additionally, the original text specifies that the representations, warranties, and covenants terminate according to Section 8.4 of the Acquisition Agreement, but the modified version states that they 'shall survive indefinitely,' which is inconsistent.
